title: “Sorc boots and oblivion orb = mages deal true damage to squishies.”
body:
They are spending 2600 gold on this while you can spend 450 gold {{item:1033}} to negate 3/4 of it.

And dont act like squishies cant build {{item:1033}} because it builds into {{item:3139}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3111}} for AD or {{item:3102}} {{item:3111}} for AP. You have no excuse to not build this item, so if you arent willing to sacrifice like 5-10% of your damage to stop mages from dealing “true damage” to you then you aren’t allowed to complain.

So everyone has to spend gold to counter mages, only? Why do I have to build magic-resist-everything just to counter a Xerath/Zyra/Brand SUPPORT? There's a big bloody problem with the mage items combined with the fact that mages generally have very high base damage. MR doesn't do jackshit, running around like a headless chicken to dodge spells while getting CS because you can't get in range to poke a SUPPORT with ONE ITEM is a big fucking problem. If you're gonna tell me that I need to rush all of the items mentioned just to survive, then how much impact do you think I'm going to have against anyone that has Ninja tabi?

The problem is that mages can go for their core items without losing out on anything (Morello, Luden's, Liandry + Rylai, Rabbadon, Zhonyas, Void, RoA - whichever really). For MR to be efficient, you need HP as well; our main items don't give HP, few AD items (Frozen Mallet, Trinity Force) give HP. Needless to say, that's not the case for mages, because they get HP from most of their items by default, and god knows why that's the case. If I DO get in range to punish a mage that's been sitting behind a tower and spamming skillshots, why the hell do I have to deal with someone that has 2k+ HP and likely the armor from a Zhonya's as well? How do magic damage counters even remotely compare to the ones available to ADC's?

Lifesteal is not efficient unless you have attack speed and high base AD while being able to get in range, chances are there are no minions nearby and you certainly won't chase down a Xerath/Ziggs/Brand/Lux or whatever when their spells barely have any CD. Most of them will have Morello which negates healing even further; the gold is just not worth the stats against the burst / grievous wounds / dot dmg.. It feels terrible to buy any of them because it rarely makes a difference, Dark Harvest is a thing as well, you don't even have to hit more than 2/3 spells to do enough damage later on in the game (Or 1 in case you're Karthus jungle, because spamming R and scaling your DH is a thing ). 

It doesn't matter if you're immobile though, not all ADC's have a dash either. Most mages have slows/snares/stuns or the likes on one or more spells in their kit, that's usually plenty to keep someone at bay unless they flash on you -- but that's how it works for ADC's too. You can't say the CD's are long, they are not. You'd think that mana issues would be relevant, but not even that. I just want to be able to play ADC (Jinx, Twitch, Kalista) again without feeling like I'm handicapping myself. I'm spamming Zyra support at the moment on this acc just to prove a point. Frostfang needs a nerf so people will quit spamming mages on support and having the most dmg dealt at the end of all games while getting items at the same pace as midlaners would. Beyond that, it'd just be nice if the dmg output would get nerfed overall. Buff the mana regen on mages if needed, but give a window to allow actual counterplay; I don't see any sensible reason that mages should be allowed to deal the same amount of damage as assassins although on a lower CD, but from half across the map and to multiple targets if they please. :T
